layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: What I consume mentally — content, media, information — is ...

answers.4: my choice, though I don't always choose well
answers.2: hard to control given how much is pushed at me
answers.3: partly my choice, partly what the algorithm feeds me
answers.1: mostly determined by what's around me

answers.4: mine to change, though some are stubborn
answers.2: deeply ingrained — hard to change at this point

questions.text: My current state of knowledge is ...
questions.principle: No excuses for lack of learning

answers.4: mostly my responsibility, though I started behind
answers.5: my responsibility — I can learn anything I decide to
answers.2: shaped by opportunities I didn't have
answers.3: partly my background, partly my effort
answers.1: limited by my education and background

answers.4: my job, though good resources make it easier
answers.5: my job — I find what I need
answers.2: limited by what's available to me
answers.3: partly on me, partly on having access to good material
answers.1: dependent on having the right teachers or resources

questions.text: When harmful influences affect my thinking, I ...

answers.4: guard my mind, though I'm not always vigilant
answers.5: guard my mind — what gets in is on me
answers.2: do my best, but some things are unavoidable
answers.3: filter some, but a lot still gets through
answers.1: can't help what gets in — it's everywhere

remediation.advice: Your mind is a garden you tend. Taking responsibility means admitting: 'What's growing here is what I planted or allowed.' If you want different thoughts, consume different content. If you want clearer thinking, do the work to develop it. No one else is responsible for your mental state.

scripture.text: Be transformed by the renewal of your mind.
